image.altText: A woman looks past the camera, smiling

props.synopsis: No criminal charges will be laid over Veronica Nelson's cruel and preventable death in a Victorian prison, after the state's workplace safety watchdog declared there was "insufficient evidence" to prosecute justice officials or a prison healthcare provider.

title.children: No charges to be laid over Veronica Nelson's 'harrowing' death in Victorian prison cell

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holding a takeaway coffee laughs with Kurt Campbell.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bridled at questions from journalists about a private conversation where he joked with US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell about splitting the cost of the Pacific Policing Initiative announced yesterday in Tonga.

title.children: Albanese caught on camera joking about Pacific policing plan with top US official

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at podium

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers says the government was trying to avoid a backlash against the LGBTIQ community when it decided not to proceed with adding questions about sexuality and gender to the census.Â

title.children: Chalmers says decision not to include LGBTIQ questions in the census was about avoiding 'nastiness'

image.altText: Rob wearing a green shirt sitting in front of a brick wall with 'house of hope' spelled out in bricks.

props.synopsis: Victoria is in the midst of a push for more social housing, but NIMBY (not-in-my-back-yard) attitudes from neighbours are causing delays and creating stigma around housing residents, according to developers.

title.children: 'Just more NIMBYism': Plans for Victorian social housing delayed by community backlash

image.altText: Tom and Juliette

props.synopsis: Despite buying a block of land in the middle of a popular Victorian tourist town's retail strip, Tom Courtice and Julliette Begg can't get water or sewage connected. The connection issues could take four years to resolve.

title.children: All construction delayed for four years in this Victorian region due to water connection problems

image.altText: Richard Marles National Press Club speech

props.synopsis: The defence minister requested a second office be opened for ministerial duties, just a three-minute walk from his electorate office.Â

title.children: Defence Minister Richard Marles opened $600k second office despite already having one three minutes away

image.altText: Mano Yogalingham smiles, dressed in a white shirt as he sits indoors.

props.synopsis: Friends of 23-year-old Mano Yogalingam told the ABC the young father arrived in Australia from Sri Lanka in 2013 and had been on a bridging visa for roughly 11 years.Â

title.children: Grief and shock in Melbourne after Tamil asylum seeker dies by self-immolation

image.altText: Robert Ovadia wearing a suit with a tie

props.synopsis: A lawyer representing the Seven network says 13 more women had come forward with complaints in relation to former employee Robert Ovadia.

title.children: Thirteen more women make complaints against former Seven journalist Robert Ovadia, court told

image.altText: A young woman and her grandad stare out at her farm property

props.synopsis: Farmers downstream of Lake Eildon affected by the October 2022 flood event want the Victorian government to introduce temporary operating rules for the lake.

title.children: Farmers 'haunted' by floods call for lake's water levels to be lowered

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie 2024-08-29 10:08:00

props.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Jacqui Lambie says her experiment in state politics has come to an end and apologises to Premier Jeremy Rockliff for the "instability" her party has caused.

title.children: Lambie apologises to premier for instability, says she won't run any more Tasmanian state candidates

props.synopsis: Kidnapped from his Burkina Faso home at gunpoint in 2016, Ken Elliott survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda.

title.children: Australian doctor who survived seven years in the desert as a prisoner of Al Qaeda speaks for the first time

image.altText: Poh Ling Yeow

props.synopsis: The celebrity chef speaks about her life almost lived as a Mormon housewife, and the one guilty secret meal she relishes making.

title.children: 'None of this would have happened': Poh Ling Yeow on the decision that changed her life

image.altText: Madison de Rozario and Brenden Hall march with the Australian flag

props.synopsis: The Paralympics are underway in Paris after a stirring Opening Ceremony on the Place de la Concorde and along the Champs-ElysÃ©es, with Australia's team led by flag-bearers Brenden Hall and Madison de Rozario.

title.children: Paralympics opening ceremony a wave of colour in Paris as Australians add to Champs-ElysÃ©es party

image.altText: A photo of a Qantas plane flying in the sky.

props.synopsis: Qantas has recorded a 28 per cent fall in its post-tax profit to $1.25 billion in the 2024 financial year, driven by fares moderating, increased spending on customer initiatives and reduced freight revenue.

title.children: Qantas boss says 'job is not done' after airline posts profit fall to $1.25b

image.altText: A bald middle-aged man looks with his brow furrowed at another man in a courtroom

props.synopsis: Robert Telles killed investigative journalist Jeff German in a stabbing that rocked Las Vegas and the United States. He will now spend at least 20 years in prison for the murder.

title.children: A reporter's stories led to the end of a politician's career. Two years later, one of them was convicted for murdering the other

image.altText: CFMEU MEMBERS RALLY BRISBANE

props.synopsis: Affiliation and donations to the ALP have been suspended, administrators forced in, and now Labor is using the bad stench around the CFMEU as a political weapon against the Greens.

title.children: A Greens MP's CFMEU antics call up memories of Tony Abbott standing in front of 'Ditch the Witch' placards

image.altText: a hand holding a phone with a bank card pulled up

props.synopsis: Neobanks are online-only branches, and experts are concerned they could be more susceptible to scammers.

title.children: Digital banks are 'a gift' for scammers. Here's what you need to know to keep your savings safe

image.altText: A pair of pink ski on a grassy hill, snow-covered mountains in the background

props.synopsis: The recent hot spell may feel unfamiliar, but weather extremes are quickly becoming the norm, as climate change up-ends the winter seasons.

title.children: As Australia basks in sunshine, ski fields turn to sludge in heatwave labelled a 'hot mess' by climate scientists

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposal to cap international student enrolments has prompted dire warnings from parts of the sector about the economic fallout.

title.children: Universities warn international student cap could slash numbers further than intended

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Australia's tennis aces have made their best start to the US Open in 45 years, with Alexei Popyrin continuing his excellent run. But Rinky Hijikata, Ajla Tomljanovic and Maya Joint have all crashed out on day three.

title.children: Popyrin powers through to Djokovic test as other Aussies falter at US Open

image.altText: A car is crushed by a tree

props.synopsis: A man has died and a female passenger is critically injured after their car was hit by a falling tree in Victoria, as destructive winds sweep across Australia's south-east.

title.children: Man dies after tree falls on car in Victoria, spot fires started in NSW

image.altText: Bri Davey smiles while holding a football. She is surrounded by other club captains including Katie Brennan and Meg McDonald

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions are favourites to defend last year's premiership, with runners-up North Melbourne also in the mix. Here are all the answers to your burning questions ahead of the opening round.

title.children: The AFLW kicks off on Friday night with a double-header â here's all you need to know about the upcoming season

image.altText: Woman and man in black suit talk at desk with microphones.

props.synopsis: ASX loses ground, Qantas records large fall in profits as parliamentary banking inquiry begins. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

title.children: Commonwealth Bank, Westpac face questioning in parliamentary inquiry

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Nikkei flat as Nvidia disappointment drags down tech
Iron ore rises on renewed hopes of improving China demand

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: How you can avoid contracting sloth fever when travelling to countries experiencing small outbreaks of the mosquito-borne disease.Â

title.children: Several countries are experiencing 'sloth fever' outbreaks but the chance of it spreading to Australia is low

image.altText: A composite image of Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold dressed in police uniforms.

props.synopsis: The families of Constables Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold tell an inquest into their deaths they are "forever broken".

title.children: Family of slain police officer say her final message was withheld from them for months

image.altText: Donald Trump is shielded by secret service as blood spreads from an injury on his ear

props.synopsis: The FBI says Thomas Matthew Crooks spent months looking into both the Republican and Democratic parties, including their national conventions, before settling on Donald Trump as a target for a shooting.

title.children: Trump rally shooter sought information on Donald Trump and Joe Biden before settling on target

props.synopsis: Liberal frontbencher Simon Birmingham has pledged the Coalition would reverse the federal government's "stubborn" refusal to reopen Australia's embassy in Kyiv, following the lead of numerous nations who have returned their diplomats to war-torn Ukraine.

title.children: Coalition pledges to reopen Australia's empty embassy in Ukraine's capital, during visit to Kyiv

image.altText: High waves are observed along the shore as a typhoon approaches.

props.synopsis: A typhoon lashes southern Japan with torrential rain and strong winds, causing at least three deaths as it starts a crawl up the length of the archipelago and raises concerns of flooding, landslides and extensive damage.

title.children: Typhoon Shanshan makes landfall in Japan, leaving three dead and several injured

image.altText: A white man wearing all black speaks with an ear microphone and his hands out

props.synopsis: The tech billionaire is barred from leaving France while investigations into child abuse material and drug trafficking on the platform continue.

title.children: Telegram boss facing preliminary charges in France after arrest

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities have many benefits for children, but not everyone has access

image.altText: A selfie of two young blonde women smiling outside an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Writer Danielle Gay shares the small daily and weekly rituals that have become part of her life since a break-up.

title.children: 'I didn't know who I was': Danielle Gay on finding a routine after a break-up

image.altText: A soldier holding a big gun runs across a sandy road in front of an armoured vehicle.

props.synopsis: At least nine Palestinians have been killed in Israeli raids and strikes on several towns in the north of the occupied West Bank, according to a Red Crescent spokesperson.Â

title.children: Nine Palestinians killed in Israeli raids and strikes on West Bank, humanitarian workers say

image.altText: A man's legs, wearing a military uniform and boots, standing on a flag on the ground.

props.synopsis: A former Wagner Group mercenary sheds light on the organisation's inner workings, as well as its training and recruitment procedures as the private army announces it has pulled out of Ukraine.

title.children: Former Wagner soldier details horrors of Putin's 'meat grinder' as group pulls out of Ukraine

image.altText: the outside of Maroondah hospital. There is an ambulance parked out front.

props.synopsis: A back-up ambulance was forced to treat a patient in the corridors of Maroondah Hospital in Melbourne's east, when paramedics were told no emergency beds were available at the hospital.

title.children: Paramedics forced to call back-up ambulance while ramped at busy Melbourne hospital

image.altText: An old silver-haired lady in a floral dress looks at a man in a suit who is holding a medal. They are standing in a grand room.

props.synopsis: Australia will soon be getting a poet laureate. But what does that actually mean? We sit down with the UK laureate, Simon Armitage, to find out.Â

title.children: Getting paid in sherry and writing a tribute to the queen: What does a poet laureate actually do?
